etymology.description: 是(是) (shì, "is; are; yes") + 啊(啊) (a, "ah; particle used to express a modal tone")
etymology.interpretation: 是啊 is a casual affirmation or agreement, essentially saying 'yes, that's right.' 是(是) (shì, "is; are; yes") confirms a statement, while 啊(啊) (a, "ah; particle used to express a modal tone") adds emphasis or a casual tone.

parts.english: ah; particle used to express a modal tone

examples.chinese: 这个答案很正确(這個答案很正確)，是啊(是啊)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge dá àn hěn zhèng què, shì a.

examples.chinese: 今天的天气很好(今天的天氣很好)，是啊(是啊)。
examples.pinyin: Jīn tiān de tiān qì hěn hǎo, shì a.
examples.english: The weather is very nice today; that's right.

examples.chinese: 你说得对(你說得對)，是啊(是啊)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ shuō de duì, shì a.
